												I really dont want to leave a negative review because I can imagine a lot of work has gone into this and I wouldn't leave a bad review if it was in pre release but it's not. The game is not finished , the ball does not behave all that well getting stuck in the middle of the lane spinning backwards on the spot sometimes . content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												A mildly enertaining bowling game, but so little content it should probably just be free. Choose between 2 lanes (basement or space), a surprising number of balls, and bowl. Thats it, the controls are what you would expect, wonky until you get used to the feel of no weight in your hand.I really wanted to like this game but there is just so little to it, no challange mode, no skill shots, there is couch co op but that is tedius with having to swap the vive headset. Also curving works extremely unaturally with bumpers. Not the most important thing but just interesting to note, if you have any curve, and it touches the bumper, it will just bounce against the bumper for the rest of the lane.

content:
Posted: March 18
												With the recent improvements Bowl VR is most decidedly the premier bowling game for VR. The basement environment is very realistic, the space lanes are really cool but most notably, it is the best bowling game for VR because it is the only one I've played that has very good spin mechanics, applied with a simple turn of the wrist. The only issues I had were taken care of and made right. Buy it.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												UPDATE:It looks like a good chunk of my concerns has been addressed with patch 1.1. I can now say that I would recommend this game. Good job dev!ORIGINAL REVIEW:I really was looking forward to a VR bowling game, and this seem to fit the bill. Unfortunately, after trying it out, I can't say I'm satisfied with the experience. Here are my findings:- The sound of everything was just wrong. The ball rolling sound was just a very short ball roll sound on loop. The pin being hit sound activates regardless of if you hit the pins or not. - Menu was clunky. The slider mech just didn't work very well and entering your name is a nightmare. Perhaps a bigger keyboard or a pointer mech of some kind would be better.- Game placed the play area in a way where the room bound was the start of the lane. Although this make sense in practice to avoid people from walking up the lane, it doesn't feel very natural bowling-wise. It's more intuitive if the room bound was set a little into the lane so you can walk all the way up to the start of the lane and throw your ball without hitting the wall with your controller.- Player adding is not intuitive. You have to press the + button or else the player isn't added. If no player is added, you're still allowed to press the Bowl button that starts a game, but the game doesn't do anything. If the name field is not blank when you press Bowl, that name should just automatically be added, especially if it's just one player. Also, the Bowl button should be disabled if there is no one in the list.- Ball mechanic is buggy. The ball can potential be stuck in the middle of the lane if thrown too slow. I know there is a button to reset the ball, but the game should just do this automatically.I will change my review in the future when these issues are addressed. Although I fully support the developer in his effort and believe the game has potential, in it's current state, I can't say I can recommend it.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												Great game. Plays a lot like real bowling, meaning I suck at it, and any skill seems to require a good bit of practice. The physics simulation is solid, spin works, etc. The space level looks really cool but freaks me out a bit as I'm afraid of heights.Not sure what else to say about it, kind of like wii bowling, but with way better graphics, in VR, and with way better controls. Definitely a great game for VR parties or the like, I don't know if I could get into it playing solo but for having friends over I think it's going to be really fun.The only issues I had were some menu buttons don't register well, and the sounds are a little basic. I don't know if there's really anything an indie dev can do about the sounds though, you really need a sound studio + proper sound guy which isn't cheap.Edit: Rereading this I felt there were really some more things I should comment on.Pros:-The game plays a lot like real bowling. You get a ton of gutterballs until you get used to the controls, then you're score will quickly start matching up with your real life score, if you ever go bowling (mine is just as awful as in reality!)-The UI and graphics look slick. The space level floor is a little basic, but otherwise I have no real complaints. My fear of heights made me avoid that level anyway. D:-The overhead screen overcomes the issue of not being able to see the pins because they're so far away and VR resolution is too low.-The scoring system is solid and allows for multiple players on one headset handily.There's not too much else to comment on there, it's everything I would want from a basic bowling game that looks good and plays like real bowling.Cons:-UI can be a little unintuitive for some of the thinner buttons. The controller "clicks" from the center, which works fine on most of the large UI panels like the options or entering your name, but some of the back buttons are a little thinner and if your instinct is to dip the tip of the controller into a button, it won't work. You need to go slightly farther forward so the center goes through.-The ball gets stuck in the lane if you don't throw it hard enough. You can reset it though, and the developer said he'd fix it today so maybe it's not even an issue.To be fair to other reviewers, I didn't play the game until after the 1.1 patch so a bunch of the stuff people complained about never existed for me.
